page.title: 08Daventry Industry (cont) III
page.content: A survey of many of these companies was made to try to discover why Daventry was chosen as a worksite. The majority of those who replied to the survey concidered the town's geographical situation, and close proximity to the M1, M6 and other main routes (road, rail & air) as one of its main attractions. Other important factors were the availability of good factory units, a skilled workforce and housing for them. In 1985 work began on the new Drayton Fields Industrial Estate, and a further one is planned at Welton Park. Many companies have already expressed interest in setting up business there.
